p: The harvested‐products analysis showed that ~5% of the harvested carbon remained sequestered in wood products at the end of our study, adding an additional ~53 g C/m 2 or 207,000 metric tons of carbon in the fast 4FRI scenario. In contrast, ~137,000 metric tons of carbon was emitted by the harvesting equipment and vehicles transporting the material off site. Thus, there was only a net gain of 70,000 metric tons of carbon from the harvested material, which represents only a fraction (~0.5%) of the carbon gains modeled in LANDIS‐II from the fast‐4FRI scenario (Table 3). Because these gains were so small, we did not include them in the overall total carbon storage for the landscape.
